data.title: Project Lima - Action update
data.body:
## Summary:
Deliver changes to GH Actions  to enable deployment of developer services (Webapps, Functions, Logic Apps, Event Grid, and API management gateways) onto AKS or any Arc-enabled Kubernetes cluster

Changes are required in the following actions to support the new App kind – “KubeApp”:  Azure/webapps-deploy,  
Azure/appservice-settings, Azure/functions-container-action,  zure/functions-action 

These actions should  
- support the “Linux app” scenarios as the Lima support for Ignite is scoped to only Linux. Windows support is out of scope  
- work with “Azure/login” action which sets the required Azure context  
- provide the deployment status 

** TBD** GitHub Actions to support ARC scenarios around Lima-Proxy if ARM is not returning deployment status 

- Deployments to Logic apps will leverage the GH Actions for Functions 
- Deployments to Event grid and API Gateway would leverage the GH Action for Az CLI to deploy ARM templates. 


### Features:
- [ ] Action update for Lima : Azure WebApp (azure/webapps-deploy) #166
- [ ] Azure Kubernetes ( for supporting deployments for Logic apps, event grid and API gateway)  #167
- [ ] Action update for Lima : Azure Functions (azure/functions-action) #220
- [ ] Action support for K8s deployments to ARC managed clusters #130
## EPD

Engineering: @nadesu 
Product:  @N-Usha 
Design: N/A

## Partner Teams:
Engineering: Jenny Lawrence (App service team), Chad Kittel (Patterns & Processes team)
Product: Andrew Westgarth (App service team), Eamon O'Reilly (PM for Project Lima)

## Related Documents:
[Lima Project plan for GH Actions support](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/t/ReleaseManagement/RM/EbTodpxOVwlCndMYNN1uDO8Bf7TdDV9vqsfhajDnmxigHQ?e=iPLZ48)

## Customer Connects:
Working with Lima V team to get customer contacts that we can work with as part of the private preview release targeted for Ignite

## Success Criteria
OKR 2.1 : Project Lima delivered at Ignite and feedback received from 10 customers tried
We will ensure first class support for Project Lima in GitHub Actions for Azure, starter templates and our Azure integrations in the Portal
